ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 124
ygData.msgSnippet: You can t hack the contents of a book out of the code on the disk.  The text inside the books comes from the server.  That guy posted screen shots of the
ygData.messageBody:
You can't "hack" the contents of a book out of the code on the disk. The
text inside the books comes from the server. That guy posted screen shots
of the book pages.

---
gr0k - Stranger in a Strange Land - http://www.juju.org
"Linux... find out what you've been missing while
you've been rebooting Windows NT" - Infoworld

> From: Eron Linver <aeron@...>
>
> The reason we don't know where the book came from is because the book came
from
> no where. It was hacked out of the code on the disk. The person does not
want
> to banned that is why we don't know where it came from and the information
is
> anonymous. But as most hackers, he/she apparently believes in freedom of
> knowledge and shared it with us.
